w4160.engine.graphics

Class Mesh

  • java.lang.Object
    • w4160.engine.graphics.Mesh

  • public class Mesh
extends java.lang.Object
    A class containing the structure of an object, as well as texture and material.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Mesh

        public Mesh()
        Default constructor. Create a mesh representing a cube.

      • Mesh

        public Mesh(float[] positions,
            float[] textCoords,
            float[] normals,
            int[] indices)
        Construct a triangle mesh with a provided position, normal, and texture data.

        Note: The provided indices are used to index data in all three arrays (namely, position, textCoords, and normals). You need to make sure position, textCoords, and normals are properly ordered so that a a single array of indices can be used for indexing.

        Parameters:
        positions - An array of the individual positions (x,y,z) of all the vertices
        textCoords - An array of the individual texture coordinates (tx, ty) of all the vertices
        normals - An array of the individual normal coordinates (nx, ny, nz) of all the vertices
        indices - An array of the indices of vertices. Each group of 3 indices corresponds to a face.

    • Method Detail

      • setMesh

        public void setMesh(float[] positions,
                    float[] textCoords,
                    float[] normals,
                    int[] indices)
        Binds the positions, text coordinates, normals, and indices to OpenGL buffers, assuming that all faces are triangles. The method will be called when use OpenGL to render this mesh.
        Parameters:
        positions - An array of the individual positions (x,y,z) of all the vertices
        textCoords - An array of the individual texture coordinates (tx, ty) of all the vertices
        normals - An array of the individual normal coordinates (nx, ny, nz) of all the vertices
        indices - An array of the indices of vertices. Each group of 3 indices corresponds to a face.

        public void scaleMesh(float sx,
                      float sy,
                      float sz)
        Scale the current mesh by the given x, y, z parameters.
        Parameters:
        sx - The scale along x axis
        sy - The scale along y axis
        sz - The scale along z axis

      • translateMesh

        public void translateMesh(org.joml.Vector3f trans)
        Translate the current mesh along a given vector.
        Parameters:
        trans - The vector along which to translate

      • rotateMesh

        public void rotateMesh(org.joml.Vector3f axis,
                       float angle)
        Rotate the current mesh counterclockwise around a given rotation axis.
        Parameters:
        axis - The axis along which the rotation is performed
        angle - Rotated angle in degree
        See Also:
        Rotation

      • reflectMesh

        public void reflectMesh(org.joml.Vector3f p,
                        org.joml.Vector3f n)
        Reflect the current mesh with respect to a plane defined by the parameters. The rotation plane is defined by a point p on the plane and the normal n of the plane.
        Parameters:
        p - the point on the plane
        n - the normal of the plane
        See Also:
        Reflection
